clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Inhaler Use in the Community
clinical_study.official_title: Haphazard and Careless Use of Inhalers, an Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective cohort observational study of inhaler adherence in a community care setting (ie. general practice clinics and pharmacies in the community).

detailed_description.textblock: Over a 2-4 week period, consecutive patients with a history of respiratory illness already prescribed a salmeterol/fluticasone Diskus inhaler will be asked to participate in this study. Patients will give informed consent to participate in this study of adherence, which will be assessed with the INCA device. Both clinicians and patients will be fully aware that the device is an acoustic recording device and that both time and technique of inhaler use will be assessed. Once consented, patients will be given an INCA enabled inhaler for 1 month and asked to use it as they normally would and then to return it at the end of one month. The days used and the number of doses used in the study period, as per the dose counter, will also be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: This is adherence as measured by the INCA device in regards to time of use. This is measured as a rate of use.
This is adherence measured by the INCA device in regards to technique of use. This is measured as a rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Age Measured in Years at time of recruitment
Gender Measured as Male or Female
Education Level Measured as either primary, secondary or tertiary school at recruitment.
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Education Level (Primary/Secondary/Tertiary) to Adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: Socio-economic Class Measured as the patient having either Private or Public Health Insurance
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Socio-economic class (Private or Public Health Insurance) to Adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Care Use Measured as the number of visits to a General Practitioner in the previous Year
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Health Care Use (Frequency of visit to General Practitioner) to Adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospitalisation Measured as the number of hospital admissions in the previous year
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Hospitalisation in the prevoius year to Adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: Exacerbation Measured as the number of Respiratory Related Exacerbations in the previous year
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Exacerbation (Respiratory related in the prevoius year) to Adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: Background Respiratory Diagnosis, divided into Asthma, COPD and other.
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Respiratory Diagnosis (Asthma, COPD, other) to Adherence

secondary_outcome.measure: Smoking History measured by three categories: 1. Current Smoker, 2. Ex-Smoker and 3. Never Smoker
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of Smoking History (Current, Ex-smoker, never smoker) to Adherence

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be a random sample of patients with a known history of respiratory illness and already prescribed a salmeterol/fluticosone Diskus inhaler. Patients will be identified in both community pharmacy centres and general practice clinics within Ireland.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Known history of Respiratory Illness
- Prescribed salmeterol/fluticasone Diskus Inhaler
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to understand study protocol
- Refusal to sign consent form
